activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald M. Shamion Jr.

records.addlTxt:
1:57 PM Defendant Ronald M. Shamion Jr. in court. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Ronald M. Shamion Jr. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Magallones states waiting on Vilas County case to resolve - would like to set out. Bond continued. adj. 01:59 PM
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:52 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Breanna Magallones.  Mary M Sowinski appears on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.
Magallones statement to status- Vilas county case still pending- was not settled as of yet due to health conditions.  Sowinski statement - resolution will be reached once Vilas case is done and if no further violation.
Bail continued.
PTC 10-18-22 at 1:30.  Magallones may reach out to JA for additional date if defendant in treatment.

2:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ronald M. Shamion Jr. in court. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Ronald M. Shamion Jr. Magallones states she would like to set out after Vilas County case is settled. Bond continued. adj. 02:37 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
3:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ronald M. Shamion Jr. in court. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Ronald M. Shamion Jr. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Pfeifer states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Magallones willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 03:32 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ronald M. Shamion Jr. in court. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Ronald M. Shamion Jr. 
In receipt, waive reading.  Set for Preliminary Hearing. Time limits waived.
Bail continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:45 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ronald M. Shamion Jr. in court. Court review of case. Court questions Defendant on counsel. Defendant trying to hire Attorney Penn - has a PD in Lincoln County - has not contacted PD. Court statement to hiring counsel/PD. Bond continued. adj. 02:49 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Ronald M. Shamion Jr. appeared by video, in custody. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Pfeifer statement to bail. Court sets bond. Defendant statement to counsel in other case. adj. 01:30 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
